Package de.hshl.obj.wavefront

Class Wavefront.ObjectLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.wavefront.Wavefront.ObjectLoader
  • Enclosing class:
    Wavefront
    public static class Wavefront.ObjectLoader
extends java.lang.Object
    Load objects from OBJ files. The ObjectLoader implements the Builder Pattern in order to enable simplified configuration. Example: 
    Wavefront.objects().ignoreNormals().loadFromFile(path)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      ObjectLoader()

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreMaterials()
      Do not load any materials from the file.
      Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreNormals()
      Do not load any surface normals from the file.
      Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreStructures()
      Ignore any OBJ structures like groups or objects and load everything into a single object instead.
      Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreTextureCoordinates()
      Do not load any texture coordinates (uv coordinates) from the file.
      java.util.List<TriangleObject> loadFromFile​(java.nio.file.Path path)
      Open the specified OBJ resource using the current configuration, and convert it into a list of triangle objects.
      java.util.List<TriangleObject> loadFromLocalResource​(java.nio.file.Path resource)
      Tries to load the file from the JAR resource folder, or a file in the same directory as the app if the JAR resource cannot be found.

      Open the specified OBJ resource using the current configuration.

        public ObjectLoader()

    • Method Detail

      • silenceWarnings

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader silenceWarnings()
        Do not print any warnings for unsupported features while loading the file.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        printWarnings(boolean)

      • printWarnings

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader printWarnings​(boolean visible)
        Parameters:
        visible - Specify if warnings for unsupported features should be printed while loading the file. Default is true.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        silenceWarnings()

      • ignoreTextureCoordinates

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreTextureCoordinates()
        Do not load any texture coordinates (uv coordinates) from the file. If the file does contain texture coordinates, they will be ignored.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        useTextureCoordinates(boolean)

      • useTextureCoordinates

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader useTextureCoordinates​(boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - Specify if any surface texture coordinates should be loaded from the file. If the file does not contain texture coordinates, a DecodingException.ConversionException will be thrown. Default is true.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        ignoreTextureCoordinates()

      • ignoreNormals

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreNormals()
        Do not load any surface normals from the file. If the file does contain normals, they will be ignored.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        useNormals(boolean)

      • useNormals

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader useNormals​(boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - Specify if any surface normals should be loaded from the file. If the file does not contain normals, a DecodingException.ConversionException will be thrown. Default is true.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        ignoreNormals()

      • ignoreMaterials

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreMaterials()
        Do not load any materials from the file. Meshes will not be split and MTL files will not be read.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        useMaterials(boolean)

      • useMaterials

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader useMaterials​(boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - Specify if any materials should be loaded from the file. If true, only faces that have a material will be extracted from the file, and faces without materials will be ignored. Also, the extracted meshes will be split up into one surface per material. If false, all faces will be loaded and will none will be split up. Default is true.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        ignoreMaterials()

      • withoutVertexIndexing

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader withoutVertexIndexing()
        After loading the OBJ file, the mesh will be converted to a representation of vertices without indices. Vertices in this mesh may be repeated. May be faster than enabling vertex indexing, but will probably use more memory.
        See Also:
        useIndexedVertices(boolean)

      • useIndexedVertices

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader useIndexedVertices​(boolean enable)
        After loading the OBJ file, the mesh will be converted to a representation of vertices and indices.
        Parameters:
        enable - If true, indices are used to avoid repeating the same vertex too many times. Otherwise, the indices will be null and vertices in the mesh will be repeated. Disabling indexing may be faster, but will probably use more memory. Default is true.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        withoutVertexIndexing()

      • useGroupsAsObjects

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader useGroupsAsObjects()
        Instead of extracting OBJ objects, extract OBJ groups. Will enable structures.
        See Also:
        useGroupsAsObjects(boolean), useStructures(boolean)

      • useGroupsAsObjects

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader useGroupsAsObjects​(boolean enable)
        Parameters:
        enable - If true, instead of extracting OBJ objects, extract OBJ groups. Will enable structures. Default is false.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        useGroupsAsObjects()

      • ignoreStructures

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader ignoreStructures()
        Ignore any OBJ structures like groups or objects and load everything into a single object instead.
        See Also:
        useStructures(boolean)

      • useStructures

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader useStructures​(boolean enabled)
        Parameters:
        enabled - If true, extract only the faces declared inside objects (or inside groups if useGroupsAsObjects(boolean) is enabled). Every face that is not inside an object or a group will not be extracted. Default is true.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        ignoreStructures()

      • withTriangulator

        public Wavefront.ObjectLoader withTriangulator​(Triangulator triangulator)
        Parameters:
        triangulator - Specifies how to triangulate polygons that are loaded from the OBJ file. Default is Triangulator.INDEX_BASED.
        Returns:
        the ObjectLoader itself
        See Also:
        Triangulator

      • read

        public TriangularOBJBuilder read​(ResourceEnvironment resourceEnvironment,
                                 java.lang.String fileName)
                          throws java.io.IOException
        Open the specified OBJ resource using the current configuration.
        Parameters:
        resourceEnvironment - Specifies where the OBJ and the MTL file can be found.
        fileName - Specifies the file name of the OBJ resource inside the resource environment.
        Returns:
        The built TriangularOBJBuilder containing the parsed file data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded, including invalid OBJ files.
        See Also:
        ResourceEnvironment.folder(Path), readFile(Path), ResourceEnvironment.local(Path), readLocalResource(Path)

      • readFile

        public TriangularOBJBuilder readFile​(java.nio.file.Path path)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Open the specified OBJ resource using the current configuration.
        Parameters:
        path - Specifies the file path of the OBJ file.
        Returns:
        The built TriangularOBJBuilder containing the parsed file data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded, including invalid OBJ files.
        See Also:
        loadFromFile(Path), readLocalResource(Path)

      • readLocalResource

        public TriangularOBJBuilder readLocalResource​(java.nio.file.Path resource)
                                       throws java.io.IOException
        Open the specified OBJ resource using the current configuration.
        Parameters:
        resource - Specifies the resource name of the OBJ resource inside the JAR package.
        Returns:
        The built TriangularOBJBuilder containing the parsed file data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded, including invalid OBJ files.
        See Also:
        loadFromLocalResource(Path), readFile(Path)

      • loadFromFile

        public java.util.List<TriangleObject> loadFromFile​(java.nio.file.Path path)
                                            throws java.io.IOException
        Open the specified OBJ resource using the current configuration, and convert it into a list of triangle objects.
        Parameters:
        path - Specifies the file path of the OBJ file.
        Returns:
        The list of extracted triangular objects.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded, including invalid OBJ files and conversion failures.
        See Also:
        loadFromLocalResource(Path)

      • loadFromLocalResource

        public java.util.List<TriangleObject> loadFromLocalResource​(java.nio.file.Path resource)
                                                     throws java.io.IOException
        Tries to load the file from the JAR resource folder, or a file in the same directory as the app if the JAR resource cannot be found. Open the specified OBJ resource using the current configuration, and convert it into a list of triangle objects.
        Parameters:
        resource - Specifies the name of the OBJ resource inside this JAR package.
        Returns:
        The list of extracted triangular objects.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file cannot be loaded, including invalid OBJ files and conversion failures.
        See Also:
        loadFromFile(Path)
